results.title: Badminton: gripping, footwork, serving
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of correct badminton technique. Shows backhand and forehand grips; placement od feet when serving and playing; and the different types of serves - low short forehand, low short backhand, flick serve and drive serve.
results.description: Demonstrates the principles of correct badminton technique. Shows backhand and forehand grips; placement od feet when serving and playing; and the different types of serves - low short forehand, low short backhand, flick serve and drive serve.

results.title: Badminton fundamentals
results.brief_description: This films intorduces the novuice to the basic rules of the increasingly popular sport of badminton. Illustrates what is needed to play the game, from the court used to the racquets and shuttlecocks and suggested attire (for the 1950s). It also demonstrates the rules of the game, how to play; handgrips, the various strokes and stances and tips for playing better.

results.title: Badminton for Beginners
results.brief_description: A guide to the basic strokes recommended by the Western Australian Badminton Association. This video is designed for both coaches of badminton, and for players new to the game. It clearly demonstrates and explains the fundamentals of stroke production, footwork and court movement.

results.title: Badlands
results.creator_credit: Pressman Williams Badlands and Terrence Malick
results.brief_description: A young couple escape into the badlands of the Mid-West after the boy has dispassionately killed the girl’s unsympathetic father. The screenplay is based on fact, namely the exploits of Chris Starkweather and Caril Filgate in 1958. The film’s originality however arises from the counterpoint between the doomed romanticism courted by Kit and the detached narration by Holly. The story is a provocative study of people numbingly alienated from everyday life. Cast includes Martin Sheen, Sissy Spacek, Raymond Biere and Warren Oates.

results.title: BadJelly the witch
results.creator_credit: Ragdoll Productions, Norma Farnes Management, Anne Wood and Norma Farnes
results.brief_description: Spike Milligan narrates this animated story of two children in search of a lost cow and the adventures this leads them to. They come across interesting and friendly animals who indeed save them from the nasty witch, BadJelly, and her hungry, nasty friend. All ends up well for the children and their cow. Spike Milligan wrote the imaginative story as well as narrates.

results.title: Baden Powell: chief scout of the world
results.brief_description: The life story of the founder of the Boy Scout Movement, compiled form original film records. His early life is shown by linking photographs and his personal sketches of such important events as the Ashanti campaign and the siege of Mafeking. From its unofficial beginning in South Africa the Movement is traced to the Boy Scout groups which Baden-Powell established all over Britain. He is seen attending world jamboree as World Chief Scout, and excerpts from his addresses are given. No other credits available.

results.title: Bad timing
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Thomas, Rank Film Productions, Recorded Picture Company and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: In Vienna a young woman (Theresa Russell), begins an affair with an American psychoanalyst (Art Garfunkel). The couple become sexually obsessed with one another, but his lack of trust, and his constant suspicions, lead her to alcohol, drugs and excess until one night she decides to take her own life. Or does he make the decision for her? A combination of thriller, detective story, and a study of alienation, “Bad Timing” both fascinates and disturbs. Technically the editing and production values of the film are superb. Also stars Denholm Elliott and Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Bad taste (D)
results.brief_description: Peter Jackson’s low budget feature debut originally began life as a 10 minute splatter film called “Roast of the day” but was then expanded into a feature, painstakingly shot over a period of four years worth of Sunday’s. The comedy/horror film which gave rise to the term splatstick proudly lives up to it’s bad taste title, offering many gross moments of extreme gore, inventively executed on it’s shoestring budget. The bare bones plot revolves a round a team of alien hunters (the Astro Investigation and Defence Service with the unfortunate acronym of AIDS), who have been sent into the sleepy New Zealand town of Kaihoro where a gang of nasty extra-terrestrials lead by the ghastly Lord Crumb, have taken over. Of course much blood and viscera is spilt as the team discover the aliens evil plan to turn the inhabitants of the town into food. Cast includes Terry Potter, Peter Jackson, Peter O’Herne, Craig Smith, Mike Minett and Doug Wren.
